8D388C26B1DD458F941B3F69A9F4A7D8.description: Explain how to become an advocate for change in the community (e.g., missing and murdered Indigenous women and girls, human rights, animal rights, protection of the environment).

6B28031629204BA4ABE64B0F79F270D8.description: Investigate steps involved in becoming a landed immigrant or Canadian citizen.

5C4EBD72A5EE4CA1AFA810FF1193ADBB.description: Explore types of taxes (e.g., earnings from wages, GST, PST) and the ways they may be reinvested (e.g., health, education, social programs for seniors and children) at the municipal, provincial and federal levels.

C3805929E2F84E5A9739FCE953929270.description: Discuss types (e.g., Goods and Services (GST), property, income) and purposes of various local, provincial and federal taxes.

95EDB7F02A70418CAE38077AFEE7C139.description: Identify the criteria and processes (e.g., age for voting, registering to vote) involved in voting in municipal, provincial and federal elections in Canada.

C3F07A534BD24A14A5DBFAA1D6E918BF.description: Analyze responsibilities related to citizenship (e.g., obeying the law, paying taxes, serving on a jury, knowing local treaty territory and history, recognizing the spirit and intent of treaties, participating in local community) as a treaty person and Canadian citizen.

8466932153DF48D194D04D08A69B429C.description: Explore the rights and responsibilities associated with Canadian citizenship.

E74587ABDBF9448CB8212EE703DE8146.description: Identify measures (e.g., recycling clothes, community food boxes, donations of garden surplus) to promote economic and environmental sustainability.

7588A2FDCF3E4C668470BA10A32BDCB9.description: Analyze ethical factors (e.g., environmental, social) pertaining to responsible consumerism

7C132CD980824625882075E390271017.description: Identify resources available to consumers to assert their rights.

5A438B82D8E84DAD9D657CB85C3D2094.description: Explain the link between consumer rights and responsibilities.

78BEA0C94654421FB9125D72A44E8589.description: Identify examples of consumer responsibilities such as: informed decision-making; actions to support a just cause; social responsibility; environmental responsibility; and, solidarity (e.g., union with other consumers).

EBC07321BB8549EE817D511F7B61EAD0.description: Examine various consumer rights such as: right to security (protection); right to information (information necessary to make an informed decision); • right to be heard; right to choose; right to meet basic needs (access to essential goods and services); right to address wrongdoings; right to education; and, right to a healthy environment.

8F4CD54548424E16928597424D58B87C.description: Investigate factors that influence responsible consumerism.

21723E8034BD445D800613DC193C0C75.description: Investigate how distorted thinking and behaviour contribute to addiction.

667FE5A15443417AB596720083714DC3.description: Inquire into addiction from spiritual, personal, cultural and community points of view.

19BA5439759C407B8403A5673E3BFC43.description: Identify intergenerational patterns of addiction and examine how these patterns can contribute to ongoing addiction.

AE2D2D5BC57449C39E6F4918F1B02859.description: Examine how social pressure (e.g., culture and norms, popularity) can influence addictive behaviours.

1B8DFB2F184740A48D25E2A3ABF5C6E8.description: Examine the characteristics of resilience and how it can help prevent or mitigate addiction.

5D45D96B88B746DCA8E2749D4E970055.description: Identify signs and symptoms of addiction

99864FBF98974BAC94482C0C809C9234.description: Explore reasons why (e.g., relaxation, trauma, curiosity) an individual might choose to consume addictive substances.

869657980914483999857EF7A06A9C5D.description: Inquire into biological factors (e.g., genetics, mental illness, age) that can contribute to risk of addiction.

8A486EAE13C246AD831B235B92AAF7FA.description: Identify the potential impacts of the overuse of social media (e.g., mental wellness, anxiety, depression, negative effect, cyber bullying, quality of sleep) on self, individual and community well-being.

3662CD9119DD4F96BC9AA229757C254D.description: Discuss various types of substance and behavioural addictions (e.g., gambling, drugs and alcohol, vaping, social media).

CEF8F060CCEE4718B8B39677D50E3BE8.description: Investigate the effects of addiction on the health and well-being of individuals and community.

60B85FF441F04238989775F6543F9CBA.description: Investigate the symptoms, treatment options and potential impacts of one or more of the following mental health disorders: attention deficit hyperactivity disorder; post-traumatic stress disorder; depression; anxiety disorders; eating disorders; and, addictions such as substance-use and gambling.

E423CCB3DFEB45B5B2FFB8E874B8B17E.description: Discuss valuable skills (e.g., positive self-perception, stress management, positive social network, resilience) for maintaining mental wellness.

56454B46F45A49BC8F4C53B49929F939.description: Contrast the episodic nature of mental illness with fluctuation in moods.

EE0F0997684544BDA8A77AD63FC39F0E.description: Discuss consequences (e.g., embarrassment, shame, resentment) of stigmas and misconceptions of mental health within society.

A1FB5FEA6FF7415D970D28D2EC6E7AF5.description: Investigate the positive mental health effects that can be achieved through developing a connection with nature

4043D57C06B048ACAD5AC11D28CB6D81.description: Analyze how Western, Indigenous, traditional, complementary and alternative approaches to health care can contribute to a holistic perspective of mental wellness.

D5D6041B1A4F43D2A6C7842D10B6DBD6.description: Identify risky behaviours (e.g., drug use, gang affiliation, toxic relationships, alcohol, self-harm) that can be symptomatic of mental illness.

BF753E1ACA0344EB985C7129B5A09507.description: Investigate supports in the local community to maintain positive mental wellness.

36452AAEB01A48A1811026A0971A5993.description: Research potential mental health challenges tied to disorders (e.g., Autism Spectrum Disorder, Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder, Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder) and the services and supports available in the local community and in Saskatchewan

FDE7CF653C3C4F6B9B7BCD5E393769B2.description: Examine signs and symptoms of stress such as: emotional (e.g., burnout, irritability, anxiety); mental (e.g., constant worry, difficulty concentrating); and, physical (e.g., headache, muscle aches, sleep disturbance)

27098FF3B5E0425E9AA425FDBCE13086.description: Analyze various predisposing or precipitating factors (e.g., loss of a loved one, finances, chemical imbalance, life transitions and trauma) that contribute to mental illness.

A5664B29E98A462E93BF520C0567C3D2.description: Examine the interactions and interconnectedness between the dimensions of wellness (e.g., mental, spiritual, emotional and physical) and how they impact mental health.

E1C1D251CEDB4D0DB91D6F88057A9E9B.description: Assess personal current levels of wellness through inventories that address multiple dimensions (e.g., mental, spiritual, emotional and physical) of wellness.

71DF188BBDCD4D41A1A7589D5F36427A.description: Examine the meaning of holistic well-being and how mental health fits into that definition.

D3B3D052A3DC4FF288D7546E2E3F085A.description: Investigate holistic approaches to mental wellness.

01FDAAEE75EB4678BC6BDC5BCBAE1FAB.description: Assess personal time management practices and identify common time wasters.

8E3381905A274139A08C7D0CC8B6A296.description: Discuss potential challenges of excessive time spent on digital devices and impacts on intellectual, physical, emotional and spiritual well-being.

1CF7F3025BB34E38901137B26AEA8395.description: Examine the importance of quality sleep and the effects (e.g., irritability, fatigue, energy) of lack of sleep

7B0D6BA0221C437A9CF5CD33E7C604AE.description: Explore healthy behaviour patterns (e.g., exercise, sleep, good hygiene, proper nutrition) in balancing personal, family, community and work life in order to reduce effects such as burn out, depression and stress

63AE3828750040EB959C6259993A9912.description: Examine a variety of cultural approaches to achieving life balance.

13F47A5B016848018542984359A23FC2.description: Explore influences (e.g., career, recreational activities) on life balance.

CB1419705ECE499589DB0D23BFCE8593.description: Inquire into what it means to have personal, family, community and work life balance.

FF8FCA045D8846C68EAA4EFE0A85E074.description: Analyze factors that influence life balance.

68462E7D40E94D9082375922B2D30A19.description: Investigate factors (e.g., finances, children, living arrangements, emotions) that impact decisions to end a relationship.

65043C2726F0490C9B0A26F230639206.description: Examine behaviours associated with sexual harassment (e.g., cat-calling, making sexual comments about a person’s body, using unwanted pet names).

B9E85BB32ADF4AC1B9C28D324DF17393.description: Develop strategies to end toxic relationships.

6BB2697C198249989BF3A22401BE62B7.description: Recognize characteristics (e.g., jealousy, resentment, dishonesty, control) of toxic relationships.

643D3E97793047248504CAEE2AE34772.description: Define sexual consent and how it can be communicated.

04BB1958C7C04E5EBD8D3C2C9597A8AD.description: Explore the importance of clear, honest communication regarding sexual contact in a dating relationship.

35A38B010EB542B7A3C65CB744B60C88.description: Discuss how effective communication is important in maintaining, strengthening and ending relationships.

787F2CD7B02B46AA898A45FEA0F85CE6.description: Investigate causes of conflicts (e.g., role expectations, personality clashes, spiritual/cultural beliefs) within relationships.

1DC4315B1009479F88C7236694FF73DA.description: Analyze how the use of technology (e.g., social media, gaming, texting) can affect interpersonal relationships.

A33246FF453547B98F1761505344D5C7.description: Explore how positive or negative peer pressure (e.g., bullying, gangs, teamwork) can have an impact on self-esteem.

A7E528B2272A4C02B94D4CC7AF610B9B.description: Examine the ways in which relationships can positively or negatively affect personal physical and emotional well-being.

48B744BDE8054D358878967301CE52E1.description: Investigate various cultural norms and customs (e.g., multi-generational households, Indigenous kinship systems) in relationships.

81DA05B89976439C881BA0C6EBBF2D37.description: Identify key elements (e.g., honesty, trust, support, independence) that form the basis of healthy relationships.

1FE721F8C8514A59AC30B9983A57FE43.description: Discuss various types of relationships (e.g., family, friend, professional).

8154FF522E6C4398ACB399EFA35A670B.description: Analyze elements of strong and healthy relationships.

06436CF57C8F491AB50B564FF523A622.description: Identify skills required to self-advocate when accessing health-care products and services (e.g., developing health care directives, indicating organ donation wishes, researching alternatives, gaining second opinions).

2F96122BCB9A4E9191870481CE656C1F.description: Investigate the eligibility requirements, claims processes and services (e.g vision, dental, prescription) available through the provincial government health insurance plan, federal programs (i.e., Non-Insured Health Benefits Program and Interim Federal Health Program) and private or employerfunded health insurance plans.

240A35E582AF4BE1809F90EB94F20EE0.description: Describe possible self-care products and the benefits and challenges of these products.

36043245A31C42BDBC7E11F68B8D8775.description: Describe possible self-care actions (e.g., exercise program, nutrition plans, sleep plans) and benefits and challenges of these actions.

47E1B2291CAB4C299FCB72D7BFC8CA2E.description: Explore resources (e.g., emergency room visit, extended hours medical clinic, pharmacist consultation, family doctor, HealthLine 811) to access medical attention and the processes to obtain these services.

5E1A35836BD646259FC4BB27E18D8A2F.description: Examine situations (e.g., headache, missed menstrual cycle, depression) when care is required including life-threatening situations and long-lasting or unusual symptoms.

9705716BC5C2442EA88CB7ED6D46F5E7.description: Identify self-care resources, services and products available in the community

A9BE2549593B4669A465A61306B5941B.description: Explore self-care resources, services and products available in Saskatchewan.

2033349B60C840BB8CD2028C9A1137E5.description: Investigate the effects of intersectionality on the experiences of people.

DA0AFC30F567439BB1ED703729F5F891.description: Examine personal and collective actions to make institutions, workplaces and communities more welcoming and inclusive to diverse populations.

15D4C5A2B23E4E7DAE8B3943B6C570E4.description: Assess how community diversity enhances the well-being of self, family and community.

A490B56C6C4C43339F30CAD737E5D5A4.description: Explore how to become an ally to support positive and inclusive change.

25E7CA2601A94C9CA861380C916C1965.description: Recognize, name and challenge instances of inequity, bias, intolerance and discrimination

C9EF7C80925A4674A8CFCA2F7963B451.description: Identify inclusive language and behaviours related to diversity and equity in a variety of settings.

C8DF7D718C514C50AF09A1EFCB530F81.description: Recognize what privilege is and how it relates to gender, race and social class.

D68971FD8FF245E39C506AFF91E02C7D.description: Analyze how sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender, gender expression and perceived gender influence opportunities and interactions.

3237195E61644130B1C7A392F0C4F2A1.description: Determine how individuals are influenced by norms, trends, images and values about equity, diversity and inclusion in a variety of scenarios.

04328F2251FB43B2997C9C060AE3ADFA.description: Analyze the purpose of Canada’s Employment Equity Act with a focus on the passage “no person shall be denied employment opportunities or benefits for reasons unrelated to ability”.

92AAA517A8F14CB998F315ACF17DD281.description: Investigate an aspect of social inequity in the community (e.g., income, housing, health care, systemic barriers).

DB862189D8F1403399C0CBFC74ABC419.description: Explore what constitutes diversity (e.g., race, ethnicity, culture, gender, ability).

B25224E3B5AB40B1A89B9457FCE34EC5.description: Assess personal understanding and self-awareness of equity, diversity and inclusion.

A0DA3C1F404949D4B619BCCB2FAB303E.description: Compare nutrition fact tables (e.g., carbohydrate, fat, protein) of similar food items and their possible impact on personal well-being.

1EF57981A8594BE2AB43676CC438D319.description: Examine the possible health consequences (e.g., cardio-vascular disease, hypertension, diabetes) of long-term consumption of food with low nutritional value.

2A329F058C4542FABE954B500F106DDE.description: Research the variance in food costs based on international, national, provincial, territorial and regional geography.

A223E9B958E44151AEABD596E96CD787.description: Estimate the cost of eating a healthy, balanced diet (e.g., fresh fruit and vegetables, lean protein, whole foods).

91ED9F5030A9458A9A114D0EC917E8F3.description: Explore costs of various meals (e.g., self-prepared, meal subscription boxes, restaurants).

C81F1CECA8204760992305AC1EC635E4.description: Investigate available community resources (e.g., food banks, community kitchens, school meal programs, community gardens) that provide additional access to nutritious and affordable foods.

89B3089CF2EE489AB94B5D2695286F4E.description: Investigate the impact of diets and personal food choices on personal wellbeing.

F24FC090A8B942D1A7094B12B094E2F2.description: Examine personal and external factors (e.g., availability, religion, affordability) that influence food choices.

1DB4C0812BCB42FAB6D512DE0C0DD1C9.description: Identify food choices that impact personal and community wellbeing.

5391540D1FBE4FDE95E671A93D322C2A.description: Propose strategies for keeping living areas free of pests (e.g., bed bugs, ants, rodents) and propose possible solutions to resolve pest issues independently and with the support of landlords and service providers.

0DC7BAF5D1CD47DDBD7DEC1B932CB4C1.description: Explore options for sharing responsibilities (e.g., doing dishes, cleaning the bathroom, snow removal, garbage removal) with roommates to enhance safety and enjoyment of shared living accommodations.

FB87AC4CA1014629B28EC7DBA5F8BFE7.description: Develop a plan, incorporating safe and effective strategies and products, for regular cleaning of commonly used areas in the home (e.g., kitchen, bathroom, living room, bedroom).

5E8F49A284014F36925D0C506964EC48.description: Demonstrate safe and proper use of household equipment and appliances (e.g., washing machines, dryers, irons, dishwashers, stoves and ovens).

41644F5CA87146749ACFF41D897EE1B5.description: Discuss ways (e.g., repairing, maintaining, donating) to extend the use of items such as clothing, household appliances and vehicles.

ACB6AB556A5840E3AB46333F5DBE4BFC.description: Explain the four laundry care categories (i.e., washing, drying, dry-cleaning, ironing).

A90A8480C727487A8DD90494CAECB6CE.description: Locate and identify laundry care symbols found on clothing and other fabric items such as towels, sheets and blankets.

7A2712C1E5854BF8B5F7FD82BA98F8B7.description: Investigate ways to care for and maintain items that support living independently.

5C76DFB81FE74FC896E2A8B77AF1AE80.description: Care and Maintenance of Personal Items (Optional)

69E0C700703B48D78682E01C0C8BE302.description: Research the possible effects or consequences (e.g., injury, loss of property, death) of being unprepared for a variety of possible emergencies.

2B142A55971747F684E28BFBC6F65293.description: Explain how to access emergency and fire safety information and communications (e.g., highway hotline, weather channel, SaskAlert, emergency phone numbers, muster points) during an event.

904179D708044ED5ABAED929031E4231.description: Describe emergency preparedness for a variety of scenarios such as severe weather, power outages and fires.

CD2C6CBF55A5467F952AA573939A5969.description: Discuss ways to ensure fire safety in a variety of home and social situations (e.g., safe barbecuing and cooking tips, appropriate fire extinguishing, electrical safety).

D8673C05DA1848788FA37FA1BE79477A.description: Identify potential risks to physical safety as a result of emergencies and natural disasters (e.g., wildfire or grassfire nearing community, house fire due to unsafe cooking habits, imminent tornado or flooding).

A975EB2B33214A8B869591875F534656.description: Investigate the importance of physical safety to health and well-being.

34950533EF674433A7CC5D29CED3DD26.description: Explain how to access and communicate with support people (e.g., counselors, medical professionals, police) in an emergency situation

8918BDA5C7F14705AFC00586267A82BC.description: Describe precautions (e.g., logging out of and closing online sessions, keeping private information about banking, passwords or absences from home) used to protect personal information online

C7647A85215C49398C2A8057996F0FE1.description: Analyze potential risks associated with sharing personal information on social media, including those related to privacy and security.

B7B54B57759D4B4E8FEEE3ACDC3C546A.description: Investigate the risk factors (e.g., race, age, gender, marginalised groups, socio-economic status) related to grooming for exploitation, sexual exploitation and human trafficking of children and youth.

C0D17F97A51F4C4C8B625409F59C02E0.description: Identify areas (e.g., public transportation, hospitality industry) that are potentially associated with exploitation, sexual exploitation and human trafficking of children and youth.

61D9219989D04BA5B4E71381B375DF54.description: Discuss ways to ensure personal safety and the safety of others in a variety of social situations (e.g., attending a social event with a friend rather than alone, applying media awareness when participating in social media conversations, displaying awareness of danger to self and others).

1C642BDDA6F04FA8998D16EA075487E8.description: Identify potential risks to personal health and security as a result of overreliance on personal devices (e.g., hearing loss due to overuse of audio devices, injury to self and others due to distracted driving).

474640D1544D43549920A983B52D6E79.description: Investigate the importance of personal safety to health and wellbeing.

65F52C65EFFA40C6B4D2B0D9DF8F8774.description: Reflect on feedback received and adjust goals and plans accordingly.

559A91E0068E4125AF6CA160595BDC3E.description: Share goals and plan with a supportive person (e.g., Elder, family member, teacher, peer) to receive feedback.

F6E5140CBAAC40ACACD0387033FA544C.description: Identify short and long-term goals (e.g., personal, career, family/relationship, financial) for achieving a desired lifestyle.

F60334817316401B954C8BAAD8EE8389.description: Analyze tools such as vision boards, bucket lists, journaling and action plans that can assist with setting goals, achieving goals and/or accountability

36ED3327363947078497DEC01F06C7A9.description: Develop an action plan to achieve a SMART goal.

23086EF561D64C8E874A5EF572230C42.description: Create a personally relevant SMART (i.e., specific, measurable, attainable, relevant and time-based) goal and monitor progress.

1B9C5BD42B6747A880B9B18D2B671445.description: Research the characteristics of various goal-setting models.

B98489AC01F8463D935FC9A6D3466941.description: Debate the value of adjusting rather than abandoning a goal.

A35BB5EB3CFD4D56B5102E1083428FA6.description: Explore reasons (e.g., unexpected events, health emergency, loss of employment, changing priorities) for adjusting goals.

BAA07AF5559E45DE94F3460F188C03AE.description: Discuss the importance of setting goals and of personal accountability for achieving those goals.

2C7AA24C9D8F4DD8818B4948F24D6999.description: Reflect on past decisions and use criteria to determine whether the best choices were made.

3062AC95AF03476AB6CB8495639D78B1.description: Analyze important decisions (e.g., moving, attending post-secondary, entering the workforce, relationships) that will be made in the immediate and distant future.

9A3FE178625544CDBEEACB7F84451C6B.description: Develop a list of personal characteristics that influence decision-making.

B2F4FFECA89343999D837B3FD1C6FC0E.description: Construct a decision-making model or process that could apply to a variety of different types of decisions.

E87B69A689894F86A7762CC5BD73E286.description: Identify criteria (e.g., identification of alternatives, risk assessment, predicted results) useful in evaluating the effectiveness of decisions.

37E1913945F54A5A85CFE41708A91E78.description: Evaluate the effectiveness of various decision-making styles (i.e., agonizing, compliant, delaying, fatalistic, impulsive, intuitive, paralysis, planning) with respect to their effectiveness.

1DE90735FCB44666BA3AB1FE5A4BB8E5.description: Explore factors (e.g., personality, risk, culture) that influence decisionmaking.

0DC5AFBD26E345D79FF09C3B0097A046.description: Explore how self-awareness can inform career planning and goal setting.

7FF3F8423F7648EE9F85A11B83136F17.description: Identify various career pathways that align with one’s interests, skills and abilities.

F0425BF70BE442FCAA0AC1088A1BBCCC.description: Complete a variety of personal inventories and reflect on the results.

9EFD468AD5C346C094CDB26AAEBEC02D.description: Research the purpose of a variety of personal inventories or selfassessment tools such as Myers-Briggs and True Colours.

E5CAD21F86F348449B15859FA00D4E2F.description: Create an inventory of personal values, interests, personality traits, skills, abilities, learning styles, strengths and weaknesses.

30C23A2FD5B84B54BCFCF8A530A9E3D3.description: Examine how selfawareness informs career planning and goal setting.

FC079BA4888E47FC8CA6B545030884F6.description: Discuss skills required to manage various life changes.

68D72C783A3E4C3EBDA332C75F719EF5.description: Develop a list of strategies (e.g., accepting change, being prepared, focusing on the positives) for dealing with transitions in life.

934AFA78BABE4F12BEBD080FCE39F72B.description: Interview family, community members, Elders or Knowledge Keepers to discuss the transitions experienced in life and the influences (e.g., role models, family, culture) and strategies (e.g., seeking the advice of others, being prepared) that have helped cope with each transition.

8A3C3AD1CA0D4A13AE8ABDB74C4AB79D.description: Predict some of the transitions (e.g., moving, moving in with roommates, starting post-secondary education, getting a first or new job) a person may encounter in the near future.

0090130F4B7A4E2E9550701668FCE0FF.description: Create a personal representation (e.g., timeline, roadmap) that illustrates transitions experienced and reflect on the impact each has had on self and others.

9C3F120D595F404A9958B626B834A95C.description: Reflect on personal position in the life cycle (i.e., birth to death) and describe the transitions (e.g., first day of school, moving from elementary to high school, death of a loved one, moving to a new community, first job) already experienced.

5B15C4F6F188453C88A04EC134147A24.description: Discuss potential positive and negative impacts transitions can have on self and others such as family, friends and community.

B161427DF7044363B64A910C572E7804.description: Identify examples of transitions (e.g., starting or ending a relationship, graduation from high school, having or adopting a child, starting a new job) experienced throughout life.

ABBB25C43C1B4BB59275DF4CED99170B.description: Examine strategies for managing transitions in life.
